ygData.subject: RE: RE: Hey this sounded interesting.. *Time to KABOING ??*
ygData.msgSnippet: Hmm Sro - I ll ask - My corpse got placed under (inside) a wall in the tunnel ramp going up to the zone from the water.  The party could not see it to target
ygData.messageBody:
Hmm Sro - I'll ask -

My corpse got placed under (inside) a wall in the tunnel ramp going up to
the zone from the water. The party could not see it to target it for a
corpse drag and resuss nor could I corpse it out when I got there - so I got
to meet another GM after petitioning. I must say they are doing lots
better. My petition was answered in tell within 15 to 20 min by an
apprentice GM who confirmed my problem and escalated it to a full GM who
appeared with the time of just one fight.

Sylly.

-----Original Message-----
From: jhenders@... [mailto:jhenders@...]
Sent: Monday, October 04, 1999 2:49 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] RE: Hey this sounded
interesting.. *Time to KABOING ??*

From: jhenders@...

On Mon, Oct 04/99, James Schuldes <jgs@...> wrote:
> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> or....
> group playing in lower guk. (and they have a lev 33
cleric)
> bard dies.
> Bard sits in Hk & mem's songs while party looks for
corpse.
> Party can't find corpse.
> Party say - start running!
>
> (Wizard takes pity and gate bard from North Karana to
Cazic Thule - G'Luck
> in the maze! Train to zone!)

Hmm. Never had anyone have trouble finding my body, It's
usually right
beside the other 3 or 4. And the SRo gate is a lot closer so
why the
heck would you gate to cazic? Most of the wizards I play
with will be
happy to come gate you if you really need to come back, it's
not like
they have much else to do while they wait for recovery.
